meanings: (정보나 지식을 갖추다) know, learn, have (good) knowledge (of), be familiar (with)
(이해하다) understand, know, see, follow, appreciate, (informal) get, make out
(깨닫다, 인지하다) realize, recognize, find, notice, sense, (formal) perceive, be aware (of), be conscious (of)
Knowing too much is a disease; Where ignorance is bliss, it is folly to be wise; Ignorance is the peace of life
Knowing too much is a disease; Where ignorance is bliss, it is folly to be wise; Ignorance is the peace of life
in the manner of one being unaware of something, unwittingly
It is not of one's concern
think one knows something, but actually does not know it

meanings.meaning: snatch defeat from the jaws of victory

examples.korean: I thought he said he was coming today, but I must have misheard. 발음듣기 나는 그가 오늘 온다고 말한 줄 알았는데 내가 잘못 들었던 모양이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I thought he said he was coming today, but I must have misheard. 발음

examples.korean: I thought an opera was something similar to a musical, but they are a totally different story. 발음듣기 나는 오페라가 뮤지컬이랑 비슷한 건 줄 알았는데, 완전히 다른 거더군. DARAKWON
examples.english: I thought an opera was something similar to a musical, but they are a totally different story. 발음

examples.korean: I thought I could sleep it off, but obviously not. 발음듣기 자고 나면 다 없어질 줄 알았는데, 확실히 그러지 못했나 봐. DARAKWON
examples.english: I thought I could sleep it off, but obviously not. 발음

examples.korean: Since when did you become a gym rat? I thought you hated working out. 발음듣기 너 언제부터 헬스클럽 붙박이가 되었냐? 운동하는 거 싫어하는 줄 알았는데. DARAKWON
examples.english: Since when did you become a gym rat? I thought you hated working out. 발음

examples.korean: It’s only Tuesday? I thought it was Wednesday. 발음듣기 아직도 화요일이야? 수요일인 줄 알았는데. DARAKWON
examples.english: It’s only Tuesday? I thought it was Wednesday. 발음
